top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

You have to be careful of the mechanic's pricing-- many located in a city charge much higher prices than those in more suburban/rural areas do.  That just may eat up your "saved" parking costs (and more).
I like the creativity but an oil change costs 50 dollars too
This is a pretty good one actually

Lol. Oil change in a big city takes 5 minutes and includes a free car wash. If you are in a neighborhood with oil change shops there will be free street parking nearby.

NYC for example. No quick lubes in times Square or soho. Go out to Queens or the Bronx where there are auto repair shops and you can park anywhere you want.
